title: What we know about Matamoros and the kidnapped Americans
description: Four U.S. citizens crossed the border in search of cheaper medicines, said the Mexican President. when they got caught in a case of mistaken identity.

title: Indonesia landslides kill 10, rescuers search for 42 missing
description: Rescuers are searching for 42 people still missing after two landslides hit villages on an island in Indonesia’s remote Natuna regency

title: Trudeau orders probe of alleged Chinese interference in Canada election
description: The move fell short of the full public inquiry that opposition lawmakers have demanded.

title: UN envoy says 2023 is a `make or break' year for South Sudan
description: The U.N. special envoy for South Sudan is calling 2023 a “make or break” year for the world’s newest nation that has been beset by civil war

title: Peru: 6 soldiers drown in river while responding to protests
description: Military officials in Peru say six soldiers drowned while trying to swim across a river in the Andes to reach a town where violent protesters are demanding the resignation of Peru’s president

title: Syrian state media: Israeli strike damaged Aleppo airport
description: Syrian state media say an Israeli airstrike has hit the Aleppo airport and put it out of service

title: Argentina: Police arrest suspect in killing of 12-year-old
description: Police in Argentina have detained a man on suspicion of killing a 12-year-old boy and neighbors wrecked his house amid anger over escalating drug-related violence in the city of Rosario

title: Canadian official to examine Chinese election interference
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says he will appoint a special investigator to decide whether there should be a public inquiry into reports of Chinese interference in Canada’s elections

title: UN secretary-general says women's right are under threat
description: The U.N. chief says that women’s rights are being “abused, threatened and violated” around the world and that gender equality won’t be achieved for 300 years on the current track

title: Turkey’s opposition chooses candidate to challenge Erdogan in May election
description: After days of infighting, a Turkish opposition alliance announced that they had chosen a veteran political leader to face Erdogan in pivotal May elections.

title: Peru: 4 soldiers drown in river while responding to protests
description: Military officials in Peru say four soldiers drowned while trying to swim across a river in the Andes to reach a town where violent protesters are demanding the resignation of Peru’s president

title: US asks Mexico for trade consultations over GM corn limits
description: The U.S. government has escalated the dispute over proposed Mexican limits on genetically modified corn

title: A month after the quakes, a Turkish family wrestles with grief and anger
description: Zehra Karaoglu can’t stop replaying the day when she learned of the Feb. 6 earthquakes in Turkey, which claimed the lives of five family members in Kahramanmaras.

title: Russia advances in Bakhmut by sending waves of mercenaries to certain death
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and his top commanders insisted they would continue defending the eastern city despite heavy losses and warnings from analysts.

title: Mexican factory again draws controversy after US complaints
description: A Mexican border assembly plant that drew an unusual two U.S. labor complaints is back at the center of controversy, after a judge outlawed a planned strike there

title: After World Cup win, Argentina has eyes set on an Oscar too
description: Less than three months after Argentina won its third soccer World Cup trophy in Qatar, there is growing excitement about the possibility that the country could take home another major prize – an Academy Award

title: Russia gives fertilizer to Malawi, seeks African support
description: The Russian government has donated 20,000 tons of fertilizer to Malawi as part of its efforts to garner diplomatic support from various African nations

title: UNESCO chief promises help in restoring Iraq's looted sites
description: The head of the United Nations cultural agency has promised to continue helping to repair the damage done to Iraq’s historic sites by decades of war

title: Sudan court acquits activists accused of killing intel agent
description: A Sudanese court has acquitted eight activists accused of killing a military intelligence agent at a protest rally last year in the capital of Khartoum

title: Hezbollah says it backs Christian ally to become president
description: The leader of Lebanon’s militant Hezbollah says the group backs a former Cabinet minister and strong ally to become Lebanon’s next president

title: Protests against Nigeria's election results intensify
description: Thousands of opposition supporters protested Monday against the country’s presidential election results, as calls for a revote intensified

title: Russia declares Transparency International "undesirable"
description: The Russian government has pressed its crackdown against critical voices by branding the global anti-corruption group Transparency International as “undesirable,” effectively banning it from operating in the country

title: Paris: Notre Dame Cathedral set to reopen in December 2024
description: French officials say the reconstruction of Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris is going fast enough to allow its reopening to visitors and faithful at the end of 2024

title: US bans entry to Syria security agent over killings on video
description: The U.S. State Department has banned entry into the U.S. of a Syrian intelligence member who appeared in a video leaked last year showing him fatally shooting people during the country’s 12-year conflict

title: Daniel Harding pilots to new post as music director in Rome
description: British conductor Daniel Harding has been named music director of Rome’s Orchestra dell’Accademia di Santa Cecilia, starting in the fall of 2024

title: Judge slams U.K. police for not investigating past crimes of rapist officer
description: Wayne Couzens, the London police officer that raped and killed Sarah Everard shocking the city, received a 19-month sentence for earlier exposing himself to women as the judge lamented his behavior wasn’t stopped before.

title: Al-Qaida says 2 operatives killed in drone strike in Yemen
description: Al-Qaida’s arm in the Arabian Peninsula says two of its operatives were killed by a drone strike in central Yemen

title: Archaeologists in Egypt unearth Sphinx-like Roman-era statue
description: Authorities say archaeologists have unearthed a Sphinx-like Roman-era statue and the remains of a shrine in an ancient temple in southern Egypt

title: Landslide in Indonesia kills at least 11; dozens missing
description: A landslide caused by torrential rain has killed at least 11 people and left dozens of others missing on an island in Indonesia’s remote Natuna regency

title: Belarus sentences exiled opposition leader to 15 years
description: A court in Belarus has sentenced exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya to 15 years in prison after a trial in absentia on charges including conspiring to overthrow the government

title: A month after quake, survivors need shelter, sanitation
description: A United Nations official says one month after a powerful quake devastated parts of Turkey and Syria, hundreds of thousands of people continue to have “extensive humanitarian needs,” including shelter and sanitation

title: South African leader grapples with ever-worsening power cuts
description: South Africa’s ever-worsening power crisis — putting homes and businesses without electricity for up to 10 hours per day — is strangling Africa’s most developed economy

title: Four Americans kidnapped from minivan after driving into Mexico
description: The FBI is offering a $50,000 reward as authorities seek the gunmen's arrest and the return of the victims kidnapped in Matamoros, Tamaulipas state.

title: Amnesty says Taliban must halt their abuses in Afghanistan
description: A leading international rights group is appealing for the U.N. Human Rights Council to address the ongoing “relentless abuses” by Afghanistan’s Taliban rulers

title: Hells Angels, a synagogue shooting and Iran’s shady hand in Germany
description: Germany’s security services see an uptick in Iranian regime activity aimed at Jewish targets and the Iranian diaspora community in Germany.

title: Can American-made cheese be called Gruyère? Yes, a U.S. court rules.
description: For years, American, Swiss and French producers have battled over Gruyère cheese.

title: Iran's top leader says suspected poisonings 'unforgivable'
description: Iran’s supreme leader says that if a series of suspected poisonings at girls’ schools are proven to be deliberate, the culprits should be sentenced to death for committing an “unforgivable crime.”

title: Toblerone chocolate is no longer ‘Swiss’ enough for Alps logo
description: Toblerone’s U.S. owners decided to shift some of the chocolate’s production to Slovakia. Because of rules around ‘Swissness,’ its iconic mountain logo may be replaced.

title: Fire rips through Rohingya refugee camp in Bangladesh, displacing 12,000
description: Some residents of Cox's Bazar suffered minor injuries, but no casualties were reported. It was not immediately clear what caused the fire.

title: Suicide bombing in southwestern Pakistan kills 9 policemen
description: Pakistani officials say a suicide bomber riding on a motorcycle targeted a police truck in the restive southwestern Baluchistan province, killing at least nine policemen and wounding seven

title: South Korea to compensate victims of Japan’s wartime forced labor
description: The controversial decision is part of a concerted effort by South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol to improve his country’s tattered relationship with Japan.

title: Ukraine live briefing: As the battle for Bakhmut continues, Kyiv prepares for a wider war
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is already looking ahead to next winter — and how to prepare for more attacks on power infrastructure.

title: Amitabh Bachchan injured while shooting film in India
description: Amitabh Bachchan says he’s recovering at home from a injury suffered while shooting a film in southern India

title: First covid, now heating: Why bathhouses in Asia are in hot water
description: Going to the bathhouse is a big part of life in Japan and South Korea. But businesses are struggling after covid and fuel price spikes caused by the war in Ukraine.
